$DEFSETG.text:
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*                           Default Settings                          *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*                                                                     *
*  1) This member initializes new user's default Settings (Option 0)  *
*     and can refresh specific Settings for existing users by         *
*     defining the variable 'SETR??? = Y'                             *
*                                                                     *
*  2) To override this member, create a new member called $DEFSITE    *
*     and define/set any of the variables                             *
*     - The $DEFSITE member is optional, but if it exists, it will be *
*       read and override any settings defined in member $DEFSETG     *
*     - This will prevent from having to update the member $DEFSETG   *
*       everytime a new version of RACFADM is installed               *
*                                                                     *
*  3) The following are the naming standard for variables used to     *
*     save the user's Settings (Option 0)                             *
*     - Syntax                                                        *
*         SET#???? = #####      /* Comments */                        *
*     - Where                                                         *
*         SET .... Settings (Option 0)                                *
*         # ...... G=General, M=Management, T=Adding TSO Userid,      *
*                  P=Program/Panel (Load, REXX or CLIST member),      *
*                  D=Dataset, J=JCL and R=Refresh                     *
*         ???? ... Field name, any characters and for Refresh         *
*                  variables (4th chr = R) the section name           *
*                  (GEN, MGT, TSO, MVS, IBM, RPT and MSG)             *
*     - The REXX programs and panels will translate the               *
*       abbreviated contents to its full word, in hopes of            *
*       making it easier to understand/maintain the code,             *
*       for example: Y, will be translated to YES                     *
*     - There must be a space after the variable name, equal sign,    *
*       and variable definition                                       *
*     - Dataset names can contain system symbolics                    *
*     - An asterick (*) in column one will be treated as a comment    *
*                                                                     *
*  4) The user's Settings are saved to their ISPF profile dataset in  *
*     member RADMPROF                                                 *
*                                                                     *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*  General                                                            *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
SETRGEN  = N /* Force refresh of 'General' variables (Y=Yes, N=No)   */
SETGFLTR =                                  /* Default filter        */
SETGSTA  = 100     /* Status interval     (0-9999)                   */
SETGSTAP =         /* Status percent      (0-99)                     */
SETGDISP = V       /* Display files       (B=Browse, E=Edit, V=View) */
SETGCONF = Y       /* Confirm panel       (Y=Yes, N=No)              */
SETGMVS  = Y       /* Showmvs RACF data   (Y=Yes, N=No)              */
SETGMVSD = N       /* Showmvs LIBDEF DSN  (Y=Yes, N=No)              */
SETGPREF = N       /* Prefix dataset      (Y=Yes, N=No)              */
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*  Management                                                         *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
SETRMGT  = N /* Force refresh of 'Management' variables (Y=Yes,N=No) */
SETMADMN = N       /* Administrator  (Y=Yes, N=No)                   */
SETMIRRX = N       /* Admin RACF API (Y=Yes, N=No)                   */
SETMIBMM = N       /* IBM RACF menu options 6, 7 and 8 (Y=Yes, N=No) */
SETMIBMD = N       /* Define IBM RACF ALTLIB/LIBDEF datasets         */
SETMSHOW = N       /* RACF commands (D=Display, L=Log, B=Both, N=No) */
SETMTRAC = N       /* REXX trace (L=Labels, P=Pgms, R=Results, N=No) */
SETMPHRA = N       /* Passphrases (Y=Yes, N=No)                      */
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*  Adding TSO userids                                                 *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
SETRTSO  = N /* Force refresh of 'Adding TSO userids' (Y=Yes, N=No)  */
SETTPSWD =                                  /* Default password      */
SETTCTLG =                                  /* User catalog          */
SETTPROF =                                  /* ISPPROF dataset       */
SETTUDSN =                                  /* User dataset          */
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*  Showmvs program name and LIBDEF dataset (no quotes)                *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
SETRMVS  = N /* Force refresh of 'Showmvs' variables (Y=Yes, N=No)   */
SETPMVS  = SHOWZOS                          /* Showmvs program name  */
SETDMVSL =                                  /* Showmvs Linklib dsn   */
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*  IBM RACF's main menu panel and ALTLIB/LIBDEF datasets (no quotes)  *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*  IBM's default RACF panel and dataset names are:                    *
*    SETPIBM  = ICHP00                      /* IBM RACF menu/panel   */
*    SETDIBMC = SYS1.HRFCLST                /* IBM RACF Clist dsn    */
*    SETDIBMM = SYS1.HRFMSG                 /* IBM RACF Message dsn  */
*    SETDIBMP = SYS1.HRFPANL                /* IBM RACF Panel dsn    */
*    SETDIBMS = SYS1.HRFSKEL                /* IBM RACF Skeleton dsn */
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
SETRIBM  = N /* Force refresh of 'IBM RACF' variables (Y=Yes, N=No)  */
SETPIBM  = ICHP00                           /* IBM RACF menu/panel   */
SETDIBMC =                                  /* IBM RACF Clist dsn    */
SETDIBMM =                                  /* IBM RACF Message dsn  */
SETDIBMP =                                  /* IBM RACF Panel dsn    */
SETDIBMS =                                  /* IBM RACF Skeleton dsn */
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*  RACFRPTS - IRRDBU00 DSN (No quotes, if SETGPREF=N)                 *
*             and temp DSN UNIT/SPACE parms                           *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
SETRRPT  = N /* Force refresh of 'Reports' variables (Y=Yes, N=No)   */
SETDRPTU =                                  /* IRRDBU00 dataset name */
SETJRPTU = SYSALLDA                         /* Temporary DSN UNIT=   */
SETJRPTS = (CYL,(100,100))                  /* Temporary DSN SPACE=  */
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*  RACFMSG - Log, program and bkp dsn (No quotes, if SETGPREF=N)      *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
SETRMSG  = N /* Force refresh of 'Messages' variables (Y=Yes, N=No)  */
SETLMSG  = O                                /* O=Operlog, S=Syslog   */
SETPMSG  = SDSF                             /* EJES or SDSF          */
SETDMSG  =                                  /* Oper/syslog bkp dsn   */

$ISSUES.text:
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
*                       RACFADM - Open Issues                          *
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
  None

*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
*                       RACFADM - Closed Issues                        *
*----------------------------------------------------------------------*
  PMR        COMPONENT   STATUS   SUBMITTER  FIX RELEASE
  200417-A   RACFUSR     Closed   sbgolob    V16R3

  DESCRIPTION:
    Doing a SE (search) on a userid list from Option 1, gives a list
    of classes pertaining to the userid.  If you type "S" next to one
    of the classes (say the FACILITY class), then you get the following
    set of error messages:
    WRONG PARAMETER, SHOULD BE SPECIAL/NOSPECIAL/OPERATIONS/NOOPERATIONS

    160 +++     x = RACFAUTH(class profile user)
    69 +++  rc = display_table_permit()
    IRX0040I Error running RACFCLSS, line 160: Incorrect call to routine

    337 +++       call RACFCLSS user
    199 +++  call Profl
    IRX0040I Error running RACFUSR, line 337: Incorrect call to routine
    ***

    This pertains to V16R0.

  RESOLUTION:
    Site had an executable program called RACFAUTH in their linklist,
    causing a conflict with RACFADM's REXX program with the same name

    So, renamed RACFADM's rexx program RACFAUTH to RACFCLSA

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
  PMR        COMPONENT   STATUS   SUBMITTER  FIX RELEASE
  200311-A   RACFUSR     Closed   sbgolob    V8R5

  DESCRIPTION:
    Trying to change a userid's attributes for SPECIAL, OPERATIONS, etc.

    Type C for change, get the LU and the screen to type over.  I type
    over the attributes and the generated ALU does not list what I
    typed.

    It is no wonder, that the attributes have not been changed.
    (Just another problem reported.  This one shouldn't be hard to fix.
    Just change the generated ALU command.)

  RESOLUTION:
    Updated panel (RACFUSR5) and REXX program (RACFUSR) to display/get
    Attributes: Special, Operations and Auditor (Y=Yes, N=No)

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
  PMR        COMPONENT   STATUS   SUBMITTER  FIX RELEASE
  200306-A   RACFUSR     Closed   sbgolob    V8R5/6

  DESCRIPTION:
    Tried removing the attribute of SPECIAL for a userid, and there
    seems to be the following problem:  When you ADD attributes, the
    RACFADM dialog can read them from the line which says ATTRIBUTES,
    and it enters them into the generated ALU or ALTUSER command to
    change the attribute.  The syntax of the ALU command requires
    (for removal of attributes):  that you have to say NOSPECIAL,
    NOOPERATIONS, or NOAUDITOR specifically.  So if you want to
    remove attribute of SPECIAL, you have to specifically write on the
    ATTRIBUTE line:  NOSPECIAL, so the NOSPECIAL word gets generated
    into the ALU command.

    Once this was done:  coding NOSPECIAL in the ATTRIBUTES line, then
    the attribute of SPECIAL is indeed removed.  However the dialog
    does not do an LU to "feel" that there are no attributes left,
    and it doesn't remove the YES from the attribute column for that
    userid:

  RESOLUTION:
    Added subroutine UPDATTR, will issue 'LU userid TSO' command
    and populate the ATTR and ATTR2 variables with current information
  PMR        COMPONENT   STATUS   SUBMITTER  FIX RELEASE
  200302-D   RACFUSR     Closed   sbgolob    V8R4

  DESCRIPTION:
    Create worked fine.  Delete also seemed to work fine.  Just left
    over datasets like the ISPF profile and userid.BRODCAST

  RESOLUTION:
    Added quotes to user in DELETE/DEFINE ALIAS commands in RACFUSRT.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
  PMR        COMPONENT   STATUS   SUBMITTER  FIX RELEASE
  200302-C   RACFGRP     Closed   sbgolob    V?R?

  DESCRIPTION:
   When you add a new group, it doesn't show up in the list of groups,
   until you re-do the list.

  RESOLUTION:
    ???

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
  PMR        COMPONENT   STATUS   SUBMITTER  FIX RELEASE
  200302-B   RACFUSR     Closed   sbgolob V?R?

  DESCRIPTION:
    If you add a new and different userid under a circumstance when it
    is an error to do so, it still gets added to the ISPF table of
    userids, and it doesn't come off unless you redisplay the table.

  RESOLUTION:
    Fixed checking return code after executing RACF command

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
  PMR        COMPONENT   STATUS   SUBMITTER  FIX RELEASE
  200302-A   RACFDSN     Testing  sbgolob    V8R0

  DESCRIPTION:
    With dataset profiles that got added, and they didn't show up in
    the table until you redisplayed it.  Most of the times though, the
    new items DO show up, and most of the times deleted items don't
    show up.

  RESOLUTION:
    TBDELETE if cmd_rc = 0 on DELDSD command

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
  PMR        COMPONENT   STATUS   SUBMITTER  FIX RELEASE
  200301-A   RACFUSR     Closed   sbgolob    V10R4

  DESCRIPTION:
    I tried to do a change on a userid with a TSO segment, to delete
    the TSO Segment.  The dialog said that there was no more TSO
    segment in the list, but it was still there, and you could LOGON
    to it.  In other words, NO ACTUAL DELETION.  I don't think there
    is a command issued to delete the TSO segment.

  RESOLUTION:
    Dialog should not delete the TSO segment based on the TSO = 'NO'
    panel field value.  To delete a TSO Segment, issue the
    "ALTUSER user NOTSO" command.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
  PMR        COMPONENT   STATUS   SUBMITTER  FIX RELEASE
  200301-B   RACFUSR     Closed   sbgolob    V8R4

  DESCRIPTION:
    With RACF command tracing on, and you do the "C"  on the id, and
    change TSO from NO to YES, you get some strange pathing through
    RACF commands, it seems to be looping through them, then you get
    multiple windows, and then when you finally get out of the mess,
    with enough PF3's, the job actually seems to have been done.

  RESOLUTION:
    NOP'd the CHGD, ERROR, and DISPLAY_MSG sections in RACFUSRT.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
  PMR        COMPONENT   STATUS   SUBMITTER  FIX RELEASE
  200304-A   RACFUSR     Closed   sbgolob    V8R3

  DESCRIPTION:
    Added attributes of SPECIAL and OPERATIONS to a userid which
    didn't have any.  The YES did not show up on the userid menu when
    it re-displayed, after the change.  In order to see the changes
    reflected in the table, I had to completely redisplay the
    userids.

  RESOLUTION:
    Add code to check to see if attributes where added/removed, if so
    update the ATT column to contain YES or NO.

*---------------------------------------------------------------------*

$STNDARD.text:
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*                        RACFADM - Standards                          *
*---------------------------------------------------------------------*

  The following standards have been put in place, in hopes of making
  RACFADM easier to use and maintain:

  1) Panels
     - Member names
         $$DIR ...... Directory of all members and description
         $DEFSETG ... Define site wide defaults for new users and
                      if need be, force a refresh of certain variables
                      for existing users (SETR??? = Y)
         $DEFSITE ... Define site wide defaults overrides for new users
                      * This member is optional, but if it exists, it
                        will be read and override any settings defined
                        in member $DEFSETG
                      * This will prevent from having to update the
                        $DEFSETG member every time a new version of
                        RACFADM is installed
         $??????? ... Data/informational ($CHANGES, $ISSUES, etc.)
         #??????? ... Tutorials
         RACF???? ... Menu, data entry and table panels
       Where ? can be any characters
     - Code
       -- At the bottom of the panel are comments documenting
          items of interest
       -- All panels allow invocation of a tutorial panel
     - Main menu
       -- Numbered entries (1-99) are designated for obtaining,
          displaying/changing the RACF database (Userids,
          Groups, etc.) and customizing the utility (Settings)
       -- Alphabetic entries (A-Z) are used to assist in maintaining
          or documenting RACFADM
       -- The RACFMENU panel is a primary option menu so one can use
          the jump function (=?) to go directly to any RACFMENU option
          * For example, if one is accessing User (option 1) to
            display userids, and would like to jump directly to
            Dataset (Option 3) without having to press F3 (END),
            just type in =3 on the primary command line
       -- All entries are point-n-shoot fields
     - Tables
       -- Panels displaying tables
          * Primary commands FIND, SORT, LOCATE, ONLY and RESET are
            available and operate in the same manner
            o When possible the RESET command will allow changing
              the filter criteria, by passing it a text string as
              a parameter
          * The SORTed column is the color turquois and un-sorted
            columns are green
          * The LOCATE command operates on the SORTed column
          * Column headers are point-n-shoot sort fields
            o Can place cursor on column header and press ENTER
            o It will sort the column ascending order the 1st time,
              and if accomplished again, will sort the column in
              descending order (some fields may be reversed, due the
              column is already sorted in ascending order)

  2) REXX
     - Member names
         $$DIR ...... Directory of all members and description
         RACF???? ... REXX programs, where ???? can be characters
     - Code
       -- A comment box is coded at the top of each REXX program,
          the purpose of the code and changes made:
              /*------------------------------------------------------*
              /* FLG  YYMMDD  USERID   DESCRIPTION                    *
              /* ---  ------  -------  -------------------------------*
              /* @A1  200615  RACFA    Fixed date/time                *
              /* @A0  200605  RACFA    Created skeleton               *
              /*======================================================*
       -- Changes are documented by commenting/using a flag character
          * '/* @?? */' in columns 62-71
            o Where ??, 1st character is A-Z, and 2nd character is
              is 1-9, then A-Z
            o Also, the flag character is documented in the comment
              box at the top of the program, most current at the top
          * Example:
              parse source . . REXXPGM .                     /* @A1 */
              REXXPGM  = LEFT(REXXPGM,8)                     /* @A1 */
       -- A comment box is coded above each subroutine, documenting
          the purpose of the code
       -- All REXX programs allow:
          * Viewing and logging the RACF commands and the return code,
            by changing the Settings (Option 0) 'RACF commands' field
          * Tracing the REXX program, by changing the Settings
            (Option 0) 'REXX trace' field
          * The capability to have the user control how they want
            to display any files/reports by changing the Settings
            (Option 0) 'Display files' field to Browse, Edit or View

  3) Skeletons
     - Member names
         $$DIR ...... Directory of all members and description
         RACF???? ... Skeleton, where ???? can be any characters
     - Code
       -- A comment box is coded at the top of each skeleton,
          documenting the purpose of the code and changes made:
              /*------------------------------------------------------*
              /* FLG  YYMMDD  USERID   DESCRIPTION                    *
              /* ---  ------  -------  -------------------------------*
              /* @A1  200615  RACFA    Fixed date/time                *
              /* @A0  200605  RACFA    Created skeleton               *
              /*======================================================*

  3) Settings
     - The following are the naming standard for variables used to
       save the user's Settings (Option 0)
       -- Syntax
            SET#????
       -- Where
            SET .... Settings (Option 0)
            # ...... G=General, M=Management, T=Adding TSO Userid,
                     P=Program/Panel (Load, REXX or CLIST member),
                     D=Dataset, J=JCL and R=Refresh
            ???? ... Field name, any characters and for Refresh
                     variables (4th chr = R) the section name
                     (GEN, MGT, TSO, MVS, IBM, RPT and MSG)
       -- The REXX programs and panels will translate the abbreviated
          contents to its full word, in hopes of making it easier to
          understand/maintain the code, for example: Y, will be
          translated to YES

#RACACKN.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   @  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(RED)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Acknowledgements+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+  The source code can be obtained from:
!    CBT File 417
@      https://cbttape.org
!    GitHub
@      https://github.com/lbdyck/racfadm
+
+  The following people participated in developing%RACFADM,+in alphabetical
+  order, by last name:
!    Beaver, Steve           Kuiper, Henri
!    Dyck, Lionel B.         Pratt, Hailey
!    Golob, Sam              Rizzuto, Nico
!    Jaffe, Ed               Smith, William
!    Kalinich, John          Turner, Jim
!    Koss, Bruce             Wells, Bruce
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACACKN
)END

#RACCERT.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   @  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(RED)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Digital Certificates+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+Primary Commands

#RACCLSA.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)    HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
   $  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(YELLOW)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - General Resources+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
!   %UACC                 General Resources Access Authority
!  --------   ---------------------------------------------------------
!  NONE      +The specified user or group is not permitted to access
!            +the resource or list the profile.
!
!  ALTER     +For discrete profiles, the specified user or group
!            +has full control over the resource and the resource
!            +profile, and can authorize other users and groups to
!            +access the resource.
!
!            +For generic profiles, only the profile owner, users
!            +with the SPECIAL attribute, and group-SPECIAL users
!            +whose groups own the profile have control over the
!            +resource profile and can authorize other users and
!            +groups to access the resource.
!
!  CONTROL   +These access authorities allow listing of selected
!  UPDATE    +portions of the profile and grant resource access in
!  READ      +a variety of ways, depending on the class.
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACCLSA
)END

#RACDSNA.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Dataset Profiles+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
!   %UACC                    Dataset Access Authorities
!  --------   ---------------------------------------------------------
!  NONE      +Does not allow users to access the data set.
!
!  EXECUTE   +For a private load library, allows users to load and
!            +execute, but not read or copy, programs in the library.
!
!  READ      +Allows users to access the data set for reading only.
!
!  UPDATE    +Allows users to read from, copy from, or write to the
!            +data set.
!
!  ALTER     +Allows users to read, update, delete, rename, move, or
!            +scratch the data set.
!
!  CONTROL   +For VSAM data sets, it allows users to perform improved
!            +control interval processing.  For non-VSAM data sets,
!            +CONTROL is equivalent to UPDATE.
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACDSNA
)END

)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)

)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Group Trees Report+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+  The%Data Security Monitor (DSMON)+produces a set of reports that
+  provide information about the current status of the data security
+  environment.
+
+  The!Group Tree Report+lists, for each requested group, all of its
+  subgroups, all of the subgroups' subgroups, and so on, as well as
+  the owner of each group listed in the report, if the owner is not
+  the superior group.
+
+  And it can be used to examine the overall RACF group structure
+  and determine the scope of the group for group-related user
+  attributes (group-SPECIAL, group-OPERATIONS and group-AUDITOR).
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACGTRE
)END

#RACHEL1.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   %  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   @  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(RED)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - RACF Help Commands - 1 of 2+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
+
%Help+displays tutorials on several commonly used RACF commands.
+
+Primary Commands
%    SOrt column order +Sort the table using the column name
+                       order is%A+or%D+(default is A)
+                       Column headers are point and shoot to sort
+                       1st use sort Ascending, 2nd use sort Descending
%    Locate cmd next   +Locate the requested command in the table
%    Only string       +Remove all rows without string (ALL is alias)
@  *%Refresh           +Refresh the table after using ONLY
@  *%RL                +Repeat Locate
%    S cmd             +Select the command
@  *%SEt               +Toggles between using ISPF View and FSHELP
+
@  *!Point and shoot+commands
+
+   %SET+value is saved in the ISPF profile dataset
+
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
 &zup  = #rachel1
 &cont = #rachel2
)End

)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - RACF Help Commands - 2 of 2+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
+
+Line Commands         !(Point and shoot fields)+
%    S+                +Select a command to be browsed under View or FSHelp
%    X+                +Exclude a command from the list
+
+Notes
+    To use the tab key to access!point and shoot+fields the
+   !'Tab to point-and-shoot fields'+must be selected (turned on)
+    from the!ISPF Settings+(Option 0).
+
+    Use%Only+to display rows with a specific text string, making
+    it easier/quicker to find a command.
+
+    The description field is scrollable.  Use!F10/F11 (Left/Right)
+    keys with the cursor in the description field.
+
+
+
+
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
 &zup   = #rachel1
)END

#RACLOG.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - ISPF Log File+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+ %ISPLog+will display the ISPF log file in reverse chronological order.
+
+  To use%ISPLog,+the following must be activated/defined:
+    - From the ISPF primary menu, select option!0, Settings
+    - From the Action bar, click on!Log/List
+    - From the drop down menu, select!1. Log Data set defaults
+    - Ensure!Primary and Secondary pages+contain%10+(default)
+    - Once defined, terminate and re-invoke ISPF
+
+  If the!ISPLOG+is allocated to a dataset!(prefix.SPFLOGn.LIST),
+  then the current log file will read.
+
+  If the!ISPLOG+is allocated to SYSOUT, the!ISFCALLS+interface
+  to!SDSF/(E)JES+will be used to locate and read the JES2 SYSOUT
+  file allocated to!ISPLOG.+
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACLOG
)END

#RACMENU.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
   ~  TYPE(PS)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - RACF Administration+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
%RACF Administration+makes many security tasks simple.  It lists user,
+group, data set and general resource profiles by means of a user-friendly,
+menu-driven interface; it provides interactive modification of most fields.
+
%Among its features are:+connecting groups to a user, adding permissions,
+user authorization searching across classes, and displaying the group from
+which an authorization is granted.
+
+The following topics are presented in sequence, or may be selected by number:
+
+ %1 ~Menu                 %10~RACF databases       %19~OMVS RACF commands
+ %2 ~Settings             %11~RACF parameters      %20~RACF reports
+ %3 ~User profiles        %12~RACF IBM options     %21~Digital certificates
+ %4 ~Group profiles       %13~Execute RACF cmds    %22~DSN access authority
+ %5 ~Dataset profiles     %14~Dataset list         %23~Res access authority
+ %6 ~General resources    %15~Dataset enqueues     %24~Publications
+ %7 ~Password reset       %16~RACF help commands   %25~Installation notes
+ %8 ~Group tree report    %17~ISPF log file        %26~Acknowledgements
+ %9 ~RACF data (Showmvs)  %18~RACF messages
)PROC
  &ZSEL = TRANS(&ZCMD 1,#RACMEN1  2,#RACSET1  3,#RACUSR2  4,#RACGRP8
                      5,#RACDSN2  6,#RACCLSR  7,#RACPSWD  8,#RACGTRE
                      9,#RACMVS  10,#RACDB   11,#RACPRMS 12,#RACIBM
                     13,#RACCMDS 14,#RACDSL  15,#RACENQ  16,#RACHEL1
                     17,#RACLOG  18,#RACMSG  19,#RACOMVS 20,#RACRPT1
                     21,#RACCERT 22,#RACDSNA 23,#RACCLSA 24,#RACPUB1
                     25,#RACNOT1 26,#RACACKN
                      *,'?')
  &ZUP  = #RACMENU
)PNTS
  FIELD(ZPS00001) VAR(ZCMD) VAL('1')
  FIELD(ZPS00002) VAR(ZCMD) VAL('10')

#RACMEN1.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Menu+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
%  1)+The following are the menu entry standards:
!     -+Numbered entries!(1-99)+are designated for obtaining, displaying and
+       changing the RACF database!(Userids, Groups, etc.)+and customizing
+       the utility!(Settings)+
!     -+Alphabetic entries!(A-Z)+are used to assist in maintaining or
+       documenting%RACFADM
+
%  2)+The menu entries!(Settings, User, etc.)+are point-n-shoot fields
+
%  3)+The menu is defined as a primary menu, allowing the capability to type
+     in%=1, =2, =n+to jump around from one panel to another
+
%  4)+The bottom of the menu displays RACF, z/OS and user information
!     -+The userid field will display!Admn:+when the!Settings+(Option 0)
+      !Administrator = Y,+else it will display!User:
!     -+The characters!A, O, R+and!S+will be displayed to the right of the
+       userid when it has the attributes:!AUDITOR, OPERATIONS, ROAUDIT
+       and!SPECIAL+respectively
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACMEN1
)END

#RACMSG.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   %  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - RACF Messages+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
+
%Messages+will scan the active or backup operlog or syslog datasets for
!ICH408I INSUFFICIENT ACCESS+and!VIOLATIONS+messages in foreground or batch
+
+It uses!SDSF+or!EJES+to obtain the active operlog or syslog and userid!&ZUSER
+must be authorized to view the!SDSF+or!EJES LOG
+
+The search criteria can be userid, lpar, date, only USS messages and type
+of!ICH408I+message (insufficient access or violations)
+
+A small message in the upper right hand corner of the screen will display
+the total number of!ICH408I+messages found
+
+The!Backup dataset+name can be an absolute, relative or base GDG
!  -+When it is a base GDG, it will use the generation with a create date
+    of minus 1, due to the backup was taken after midnight
+
+A!Job card+must be supplied when executing in batch mode
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACMSG
)END

#RACMVS.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   @  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(RED)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - RACF Data (Showmvs)+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+ %RACFData+invokes!Showmvs+and displays RACF data.
+
+ !Showmvs+is open source code which displays z/OS system information and data
+  related to the current address space.
+
+ !Showmvs+can be can be obtained from!CBT File 492:
@    https://cbttape.org
+
+  To use%RACFData,+the following entry needs to be displayed on the main menu:
%    7 !RACFData +RACF data (Showmvs)
+
+  Invoke%Settings+(Option 0) and turn on:
!    Showmvs data ...... Y
+
+  If%Showmvs+is not located in the!LINKLIST, STEPLIB or ISPLLIB,+type in%Y+in
+ !Define DSN+field to specify the dataset to!LIBDEF.
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACMVS
)END

#RACNOT1.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Installation Notes - 1 of 3+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
!  1)+The REXX program%RACFADM+is used to invoke the RACF Administration
+     dialog.  It allocates the necessary files using!ISPF LIBDEF+and
+    !TSO ALTLIB+commands
+
!  2)+When installing a new version of%RACFADM,+the best practice may be
+    !backing up+the datasets,!deleting+the members, and then!copying+in
+     the new version, because:
!       -+Members may be renamed or deleted
!       -+This prevents having dead/unused members
+
!  3)+The default%Settings+(Option 0) for new users is defined in member
+    %$DEFSETG+in the panel dataset.  To override these settings, create a
+     member called%$DEFSITE+and define/set any of the variables
!     *+The%$DEFSITE+member is optional, but if it exists, it will be read and
+       override any settings defined in member%$DEFSETG
!     *+This will prevent from having to update the%$DEFSETG+member every time
+       a new version of%RACFADM+is installed
!     *+The user's%Settings+are saved in!ISPF+profile dataset member%RADMPROF
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACNOT1
  &ZCONT   = #RACNOT2
)END

#RACNOT2.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   @  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(RED)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Installation Notes - 2 of 3+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
!  4)+May want to add/display the below hidden menu options in panel%RACFMENU
%       99 !Analyze  +Verify ACL             %B !Bookmgr  +RACF manuals
%                                            %I !Issues   +Known issues
+
!  5)+The menu option%Command+(Option C), saves the commands into the user's
+     dataset allocated to!ISPTABLE+or!ISPPROF+in member%RACFCMDS
+
!  6)+To use the line command%Profile,+the following will need to be
+     accomplished:
!       -+Turn on the%Settings+(Option 0)
+          !Admin RACF API .... Y
!       -+Obtain authorization to the following resources, by executing
+        !RACF RDEFINE+and!PERMIT+commands:
+          @RDEFINE FACILITY (IRR.RADMIN.*) OWNER(SYS1) UACC(READ)
+          @        AUDIT(FAILURES(READ)) DATA('RACF ADMINISTRATION API')
+          @        WARNING
+          @PERMIT IRR.RADMIN.* CLASS(FACILITY) ID(group) GEN
+
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
  &ZCONT   = #RACNOT3
)END

#RACNOT3.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Installation Notes - 3 of 3+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
!  7)+The%User+line command%XR,+Cross Reference Report, is not displayed
!       -+Reason for this is sites with a large RACF database, the time
+         for!IRRUT100+to read/obtain the data is significant
!       -+To access/use this command, turn on the%Settings+(Option 0):
+          !Administrator ..... Y
+
!  8)+The%RACFCmds+(Option O) executes the following IBM REXX programs,
+     which are included in the%RACFADM+REXX dataset
+      %OPERMIT!...+Unix Access Control List (ACL) Management, like PERMIT
+      %ORALTER!...+Unix Security Attribute Management, like ALTER
+      %ORLIST!....+Unix Directory/File Security Information, like RLIST
+
!  9)%RACFADM+allows passing a menu option as a parameter, which will invoke
+     the option and when!F3+(END) is pressed, exit out of%RACFADM
+
+
+
+
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACNOT1
)END

#RACOMA1.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   $  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN) HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)

)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - OMVS ORALTER - 1 of 2+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
%ORALTER+provides UNIX Security Attribute Management using a syntax similar
+to the RACF!RALTER+command
+
%Required:+Path and Operands
+
%Operands:!APF | NOAPF
!          AUDIT(access-attempt(audit-access-level))
!          DEBUG
!          GLOBALaudit(access-attempt(audit-access-level))
!          GROUP(group-name)
!          OUTFILE(path-or-dataset-name)
!          OWNER(user-ID)
!          PERMS(uuugggooo)
!          PROGRAM | NOPROGRAM
!          RECursive(ALL |$CURRENT!| FILESYS)
!          SECLABEL(seclabel-name)
!          SETGID | NOSETGID    SETUID | NOSETUID    STICKY | NOSTICKY
!          VERBOSE
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACOMA1
  &ZCONT   = #RACOMA2
)END

#RACOMA2.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - OMVS ORALTER - 2 of 2+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
%Examples:
%  1)+Change the owning file and group
!       ORALTER /u/brwells/myfile OWNER(APPUSR1) GROUP(APPGRP)
%  2) +hange the permission bits
!       ORALTER /u/brwells/myfile PERMS(rwxr-xr-x)
%  3)+Change the permission bits as above, in octal notation
!       ORALTER /u/brwells/myfile PERMS(755)
%  4)+Turn on the APF and program control extended attributes
!       ORALTER /u/brwells/myprogram APF PROGRAM
%  5)+Set the owner audit options to log all access
!       ORALTER /u/brwells/myfile AUDIT(ALL(rwx))
%  6)+Set the auditor audit options to log successful access
!       ORALTER /u/brwells/myfile GLOBALAUDIT(SUCCESS(rwx))
%  7)+To turn off all 'other' write bits in a directory
!       ORALTER /u/brwells PERMS(o-w) RECURSIVE
%  8)+To specify a path and a PDS member for the output script
!       ORALTER /u/brwells PERMS(o-w) OUTFILE(/u/jdayka/john.sh)
!       ORALTER /u/brwells PERMS(o-w) OUTFILE(//'JDAYKA.UNIX(CMDOUT1)')
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACOMA1
)END

!       OPERMIT /u/brwells/myfile ID(SYSPROGS) DELETE

!       OPERMIT /u/brwells/myfile RESET FMODEL
+
%  4)+Merge the access ACL from one path into that of another
!       OPERMIT /u/brwells/myfile FROM(/u/brwells/sourceFile)
+
%  5)+Add/change an entry in a file model ACL
!       OPERMIT /u/brwells/myfile ID(JOHND) ACCESS(rw-) FMODEL

)PROC

#RACOMU1.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - OMVS ULIST - 1 of 2+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
%ULIST+displays userid's User and Group Identifier (UID/GID) information
+
%Optional:+Can specify a userid, UID, GID, shell name and/or home directory
+
%Operands:!userid
!          UID(##########)
!          GID(##########)
!          SHELL(shell-name)
!          HOME(home-directory)
+
%Note:    +Operands can be mixed case, for example:!Gid(101)+or!gID(101)
+
+
+
+
+
+
+
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACOMU1
  &ZCONT   = #RACOMU2
)END

#RACOMU2.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - OMVS ULIST - 2 of 2+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
%Examples:
%  1)+To list all userid
!       ULIST
+
%  2)+To list a specific userid
!       ULIST SAMGOL
+
%  3)+To list userids with a specific UID
!       ULIST UID(10333304)
+
%  4)+To list userids with a specific GID
!       ULIST GID(30344)
+
%  5)+To list all userids with a specific shell name
!       ULIST SHELL(/bin/sh)
+
%  6)+To list all userids with a specific home path
!       ULIST HOME(/u/samgob)
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACOMU1
)END

#RACOMVS.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
   ~  TYPE(PS)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - OMVS RACF Commands+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+IBM has developed/distributed three REXX programs to assist in managing
+the Unix environment%(OPERMIT, ORALTER+and%ORLIST)
+
+The following topics are presented in sequence, or may be selected by number:
+
%  1 ~FLIST   +Unix ZFS/HFS File Usage and Attribute Information
%  2 ~GLIST   +Unix Group Identifiers (GID) List
%  3 ~OPERMIT +Unix Access Control List (ACL) Management, like PERMIT
%  4 ~ORALTER +Unix Security Attribute Management, like RALTER
%  5 ~ORLIST  +Unix File/Directory Security Information, like RLIST
%  6 ~SLIST   +Unix System Services (USS) Information (Showmvs)
%  7 ~ULIST   +Unix User/Group Identifier (UID/GID) Information
+
+The%Command+field allows for abbreviating the commands, for example:
%  F+FLIST,%G+GLIST,%P+PERMIT,%RA+ALTER,%RL+RLIST and%U+ULIST
)PROC
  &ZSEL = TRANS(&ZCMD 1,#RACOMF1, 2,#RACOMG1  3,#RACOMP1
                      4,#RACOMA1, 5,#RACOML1  6,#RACOMS1
                      7,#RACOMU1 *,'?')
  &ZUP  = #RACOMVS
)PNTS
  FIELD(ZPS00001) VAR(ZCMD) VAL('1')
  FIELD(ZPS00002) VAR(ZCMD) VAL('2')
  FIELD(ZPS00003) VAR(ZCMD) VAL('3')
  FIELD(ZPS00004) VAR(ZCMD) VAL('4')
  FIELD(ZPS00005) VAR(ZCMD) VAL('5')
  FIELD(ZPS00006) VAR(ZCMD) VAL('6')
  FIELD(ZPS00007) VAR(ZCMD) VAL('7')
)END
/*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
/*                             Comments                               */
/*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
/*                                                                    */
/*  1) The tutorial entries (Settings, User profiles, etc) are        */
/*     point-n-shoot fields                                           */
/*                                                                    */
/*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/

#RACPRMS.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - RACF Parameters+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+ %RACFPrms+reads the!Access Control Communication Vector Table (CVTRAC)
+  in memory and displays the following RACF parameters:
!    Audit options     Model options      Tape options
!    DASD options      Password options   Terminal options
!    Database names    Setropt options    Version
!    JES2 parameters   Statistics
+
+  Primary Commands
%    Find text        +Find a text string
%    Sort column A/D  +Sort a column, in ascending or descending order
+                     +(Column headers are point-and-shoot sort fields)
%    Locate text      +Locate text in the sorted column
%    Only text        +Only display rows with text string
%    Reset            +Redisplay all rows and sort first column
%    SAve             +Save display to a dataset
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACPRMS
)END

#RACPSWD.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Password Reset+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+ %Password+will display a pop-up panel, allowing to quickly change
+  an individual's password or phrase and/or!RESUME+their userid.
+
+  This utility will use the!'Initial Password'+defined in%Settings
+  (Option 0) and if the field is!blank,+it will generate a!random+
+  password in upper and lower case characters.
+
+ !'Passphrase'+defined in%Settings+(Option 0):
+
+  If Passphrase%Y+then a "Phrase" field will displayed in Option 5
+  (Password) and Option 1 (User Profile/Add User).  Phrase will be
+  edited for 2 alphabetic, 2 non-alphabetic, no Userid, and no more
+  than 2 repeating characters.  Phrase is a 14 character field.
+
+  If Passphrase%N+then a "Password" field will be displayed instead
+  of a "Phrase" field.  Password is an 8 character field.
+
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACPSWD
)END

#RACRPT1.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+~)
   ~  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
   ¬  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(RED)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   %  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - RACF Reports - 1 of 2+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>~ZCMD
+
%Reports+will create RACF reports via a batch job using:
!  -+IBM's!DFSORT ICETOOL+using!IRRDBU00+unload dataset
!  -+IBM's Data Security Monitor!(DSMON)
+
+Report!Names+starting with the following characters where obtained from:
%  $+and%@!...+IBM's!SYS1.SAMPLIB(IRRICE)
%  #!.........¬https://www.ibm.com/support/pages/dfsortmvs-downloads
%  #ICE!......¬https//oocities.org/steveneeland/Sort_Reports.html
+
+The!Define JOB Card+panel will be displayed when:
!  -+Selecting a report and the ISPF variable!ZLLGJOB1+is empty or
+    contains the default value of!//USERID   JOB (ACCOUNT),'NAME'
!  -+Or typing in%JOB+on the primary command line
+
+The!IRRDBU00 Dsn+can be an absolute or relative GDG.  And the dataset
+name and the temporary dataset's!UNIT/SPACE+parameters can be defined
+for all users by updating panel members%$DEFSETG+or%$DEFSITE
+
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACRPT1
  &ZCONT   = #RACRPT2
)END

#RACRPT2.text:

#RACSET1.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Settings - 1 of 4+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+General
!  Default filter   +Specify a default search string, when selecting menu
+                   +option 1 (Userid), 2 (Group) and 3 (Dataset)
+
!  Status interval  +The number of entries processed before displaying the
+                   +progress status message%(0-9999, 0=Do not display,
%                    100=Default)+or the percentage%(0-99)
+
!  Display files    +Display reports/files in%Browse, Edit or View+mode when
+                   +using line commands: List, Profile, etc.%(View=Default)
+
!  Confirm panel    +Specify whether each modify operation must be confirmed
+
!  Showmvs data     %Yes+to display the below menu option and use%SLIST+command
+                    in OMVSCmds (option O),%Yes+is the default
+                     %7  !RACFdata +RACF data (Showmvs)
+                    To specify SHOWMVS program name and executable dataset to
+                    LIBDEF, type in%Yes+in!Pgm/DSN+field,%No+is the default
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACSET1
  &ZCONT   = #RACSET2
)END

#RACSET2.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Settings - 2 of 4+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+General
!  Prefix dataset   +Use TSO prefix as first qualifier of the dataset name
+                   +if not quoted!(Y=Yes, N=No is default)
+
+Management
!  Administrator    +Specify full administrator authority,+providing more line
+                   +commands: Add, Change, etc.%(Y=Yes, N=No is default)
+
!  Admin RACF API   %Yes+to use RACF API module (IRRXUTIL) to obtain
+                    information when Adding/Changing a userid and allow access
+                    to use the line command Profile,%No+is the default
+
!  IBM's RACF opts  %Yes+to display the below menu options,%No+is the default
+                     %10 !IBMSys   +RACF system options
+                     %11 !IBMRRSF  +RACF remote services
+                     %12 !IBMCert  +RACF certificates
+                    To specify RACF datasets to ALTLIB/LIBDEF, type in%YES+in
+                   !Panel/DSNs+field,%No+is the default
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
  &ZCONT   = #RACSET3
)END

#RACSET3.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Settings - 3 of 4+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+Management
!  RACF commands    +To view the RACF commands executed
+                     %Display+in pop-up panel
+                     %Log+to the ISPF Log file
+                     %Both+in a pop-up panel and the ISPF Log file
+                     %No+do not display/log (default)
+
!  REXX trace       +Allow tracing REXX programs
+                     %Labels,+display programs/subroutines/labels
+                     %Programs,+display REXX program names
+                     %Results,+display commands and results
+                     %No,+turn off tracing (default)
+
+Adding TSO userid
!  Default password +The initial password given to a new TSO user or when
+                    resetting an individual's password%(Option 5 and line
+                   %command PW).+ The password can be in upper/lower case and
+                    if left%blank,+will produce a%random+password (default)
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
  &ZCONT   = #RACSET4
)END

#RACSET4.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - Settings - 4 of 4+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+Adding TSO userid
!  User catalog     +The TSO user catalog to define all new TSO user aliases
+
!  ISPPROF dataset  +The ISPF profile dataset name to be created for new TSO
+                    users.  This field allows specifying the qualifiers to
+                    append to the userid being created.  For example, if this
+                    field contains%ISPF.PROFILE,+the dataset name allocated
+                    will be%userid.ISPF.PROFILE+
+
!  User dataset     +The PDS dataset to be allocated for a new TSO user
+                    (optional).  This field allows specifying the qualifiers
+                    to append to the userid being created.  For example, if
+                    this field contains%JCL.CNTL,+the dataset name allocated
+                    will be%userid.JCL.CNTL
+
+
+
+
+
+ \ \ (press%ENTER+to continue) \ \
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACSET1
)END

#RACUSR2.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   @  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(RED)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - User Profiles+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+Primary Commands
%  Find text        +Find a text string
%  Sort column A/D  +Sort column, ascending/descending, cols are point-and-shoot
%  Locate text      +Locate text in the sorted column
%  Only text        +Only display rows with text string
%  Reset text       +Redisplay rows and pass a new search filter (optional)
%  SAve             +Save display to a dataset
+Line Commands
%  S  !Show         +List of groups user is connected to
%  SE !Search       +Analyze user access to general resource profiles
%  L  !List         +Issue LISTUSER command
%  P  !Profile      +List user profile using IRRXUTIL@(admin RACF API)
%  D  !Dsn          +Display datasets
%  C  !Change       +Change user attributes@(admin)
%  A  !Add          +Define a new user@(admin)
%  PW !Password     +Password reset@(admin)
%  R  !Remove       +Remove user from RACF@(admin)
%  RS !Resume       +Resume user and initialize the password@(admin)
%  RV !Revoke       +Revoke the user@(admin)
%  AL !Alter        +Alter user profile segments@(admin)
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACUSR2
)END

#RACUSR6.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   #  AREA(SCRL) EXTEND(ON)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   !  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(TURQ)
   @  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(RED)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
   ~  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(YELLOW)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
%Tutorial+\-\(%RACFADM - User Profiles+)\-\%Tutorial
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
#RELATED ----------------------------------------------------------------------#
)AREA RELATED
%BASE Segment:+
!OWNER(userid or group-name)+
   Specifies a RACF-defined user or group to be assigned as the
   owner of the RACF profile for the user being added. If you
   omit this operand, you are defined as the owner.
!DFLTGRP(group-name)+
   Specifies the name of a RACF-defined group to be used as the
   default group for the user. If you do not specify a group,
   RACF uses your current connect group as the default.
!NAME(user-name)+
   Specifies the user name to be associated with the new user ID.
   You can use a maximum of 20 alphanumeric or non-alphanumeric
   characters.
!DATA('installation-defined-data')+
   Specifies up to 255 characters of installation-defined data to
   be stored in the user's profile.

%TSO Segment:+
!PROC(logon-procedure-name)+
   Specifies the name of the user's default logon procedure
   when logging on through the TSO/E logon panel. The name you
   specify must be 1 - 8 alphanumeric characters and begin
   with an alphabetic character. The name must also be defined
   as a profile in the TSOPROC general resource class, and the
   user must be granted READ access to the profile. Otherwise,
   the user cannot log on to TSO using the specified logon
   procedure.
!ACCTNUM(account-number)+
   Specifies the user's default TSO account number when
   logging on through the TSO/E logon panel. The account
   number you specify must be protected by a profile in the
   ACCTNUM general resource class, and the user must be
   granted READ access to the profile. Otherwise, the user
   cannot log on to TSO using the specified account number.
!SIZE(default-region-size)+
   Specifies the minimum region size if the user does not
   request a region size at logon. The default region size is
   the number of 1024-byte units of virtual storage available
   in the user's private address space at logon. The specified
   value must be an integer 0 - 2096128.
!UNIT(unit-name)+
   Specifies the default name of a device or group of devices
   that a procedure uses for allocations. The specified value
   must be 1 - 8 alphanumeric characters.

%CICS Segment:+
!OPCLASS(operator-class ...)+
   Specifies numbers 1 - 24, defined as two digits,
   representing classes assigned to this operator to which BMS
   (basic mapping support) messages are to be routed.
!OPIDENT(operator-id)+
   Specifies a 1 - 3 character identification of the operator
   for use by BMS.
!OPPRTY(operator-priority)+
   Specifies the number from 0 - 255 that represents the
   priority of the operator.
!TIMEOUT(timeout-value)+
   Specifies the time, in hours and minutes, that the operator
   is allowed to be idle before being signed off. The value
   for TIMEOUT can be entered in the form m, mm, hmm, hhmm,
   where the value for m or mm must be 00 - 59, or 00 - 60
   when h or hh is not specified or is specified as 0 or 00.
   The value for h or hh must be 00 - 99.

%DFP Segment:+
!DATACLAS(data-class-name)+
   Specifies the default data class. The maximum length of
   data-class-name is 8 characters.
  ~Note: The value you specify must be a valid data class name
   defined for use on your system.+
!MGMTCLAS(management-class-name)+
   Specifies the default management class. The maximum length
   of management-class-name is 8 characters.
  ~Note: The value you specify must be protected by a profile
   in the MGMTCLAS general resource class, and the user must
   be granted at least READ access to the profile. Otherwise,
   RACF does not allow the user access to the specified
   MGMTCLAS.+
!STORCLAS(storage-class-name)+
   Specifies the default storage class. The maximum length of
   storage-class-name is 8 characters.
  ~Note: The value you specify must be protected by a profile
   in the STORCLAS general resource class, and the user must
   be granted at least READ access to the profile. Otherwise,
   RACF does not allow the user access to the specified
   STORCLAS.+

%OMVS Segment:+
!HOME(initial-directory-name)+
   Specifies the user's z/OS UNIX initial directory pathname.
   This is the current working directory for the user's
   process when the user enters the TSO/E.
!PROGRAM(program-name)+
   Specifies the PROGRAM pathname (z/OS UNIX shell program).
   This is the first program started when the TSO/E command
   OMVS is entered or when a batch job is started using the
   BPXBATCH program.
)PROC
  &ZUP     = #RACUSR6
)END

OPERMIT.text:
)F Function -
  Purpose:  Provides UNIX Access Control List (ACL) management using a
            syntax consistent with the RACF PERMIT command

)X Syntax -
  OPERMIT absolute-path-name operands

)O Operands -
  All keywords are optional
          absolute-path-name     (positional and required)
          ACCess(access-authority) / DELETE
          ACL FMODEL DMODEL / ALL - type(s) of ACL being modified.
          ---
          CLASS(FSSEC)
          DEBUG
          FROM(absolute-path-name)
          FTYPE(ACL/FMODEL/DMODEL)
                ---
          ID(name ...)
          OUTFILE(path-or-dataset-name)
          RECursive(ALL / CURRENT / FILESYS)
                          -------
          RESET
          VERBOSE

))Examples -
  1) Permit user JOHND to an access ACL
       OPERMIT /u/brwells/myfile CLASS(FSSEC) ID(JOHND) ACCESS(r-x)
     or
       OPERMIT /u/brwells/myfile              ID(JOHND) ACCESS(r-x)

  2) Remove access of group SYSPROGS from an access ACL
       OPERMIT /u/brwells/myfile ID(SYSPROGS) DELETE

  3) Remove an entire access list
       OPERMIT /u/brwells/myfile RESET
       OPERMIT /u/brwells/myfile RESET FMODEL

  4) Merge the access ACL from one path into that of another
       OPERMIT /u/brwells/myfile FROM(/u/brwells/sourceFile)

  5) Add/change an entry in a file model ACL
       OPERMIT /u/brwells/myfile ID(JOHND) ACCESS(rw-) FMODEL

ORALTER.text:
)F Function -
  Purpose:  Provides UNIX Security Attribute Management using a syntax
            similar to the RACF RALTER command

)X Syntax -
  ORALTER absolute-path-name operands

)O Operands -
  All keywords are optional
           FSSEC                (positional)
           absolute-path-name   (positional and required)
           APF / NOAPF
           AUDIT(access-attempt(audit-access-level))
           DEBUG
           GLOBALaudit(access-attempt(audit-access-level))
           GROUP(group-name)
           OUTFILE(path-or-dataset-name)
           OWNER(user-ID)
           PERMS(uuugggooo)
           PROGRAM / NOPROGRAM
           RECursive(ALL / CURRENT / FILESYS)
                           -------
           SECLABEL(seclabel-name)
           SETGID / NOSETGID
           SETUID / NOSETUID
           STICKY / NOSTICKY
           VERBOSE

))Examples -
   1) Change the owning file and group
        ORALTER /u/brwells/myfile OWNER(APPUSR1) GROUP(APPGRP)

   2) Change the permission bits
        ORALTER /u/brwells/myfile PERMS(rwxr-xr-x)

   3) Change the permission bits as above, in octal notation
        ORALTER /u/brwells/myfile PERMS(755)

   4) Turn on the APF and program control extended attributes
        ORALTER /u/brwells/myprogram APF PROGRAM

   5) Set the owner audit options to log all access
        ORALTER /u/brwells/myfile AUDIT(ALL(rwx))

   6) Set the auditor audit options to log successful access
        ORALTER /u/brwells/myfile GLOBALAUDIT(SUCCESS(rwx))

   7) To turn off all 'other' write bits in a directory
        ORALTER /u/brwells PERMS(o-w) RECURSIVE

   8) To specify a path for the output script
        ORALTER /u/brwells PERMS(o-w) OUTFILE(/u/jdayka/john.sh)

   9) To specify a PDS member for the output script
        ORALTER /u/brwells PERMS(o-w) OUTFILE(//'JDAYKA.UNIX(CMDOUT1)')

ORLIST.text:
)F Function -
  Purpose:  Display security information for a Unix directory or file using
            a syntax and output format similar to the RACF RList command

)X Syntax -
  ORLIST absolute-path-name operands

)O Operands -
  All keywords are optional
           FSSEC                (positional)
           absolute-path-name   (positional and required)
           AUTH
           DEBUG
           NODISplay
           OUTFILE(path-or-dataset-name)
           RECursive(ALL / CURRENT / FILESYS)
                           -------

))Examples -
   1) Display all security information
        ORLIST FSSEC /u/brwells/myfile

   2) Display all security information omitting the optional class name
        ORLIST /u/brwells/myfile

   3) Display only the attributes used in a POSIX access decision
        ORLIST /u/brwells/myfile AUTH

   4) Write information for an entire directory to an output file
      without diplaying it on the terminal
        ORLIST /u/brwells/myfile RECURSIVE NODISPLAY

RACFCLSC.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   $  TYPE(OUTPUT)  INTENS(LOW)  JUST(LEFT) COLOR(TURQ)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) JUST(LEFT) CAPS(ON)     HILITE(USCORE)
   {  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)   COLOR(BLUE)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)   COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
+\-\(%RACFADM - General Resources+)\-\
%Command ===>_ZCMD                                              +Scroll==>_SAMT+
%
+Add RACF%&RCLASS  +member
{This function will add a member to this profile.
+
+CLASS  %===>$RCLASS  +
+PROFILE%===>$PROFILE                            +
+
+
+
+ID     %===>_ID      { (Member to be added)
+
+
+
+
+
+
+
+
+
+
+\ \Press%ENTER+to process or%END+to exit\ \
)INIT
  .CURSOR = ID
  .HELP   = #RACMENU
  IF (&ID = NONE)
      &ID = ' '
  &OLDID = &ID
)PROC
  VER (&ID,NB)
)END

)ATTR DEFAULT(~+_)

   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
+\-\(~RACFADM - General Resources+)\-\
~Command ===>_ZCMD
~
+Process RACF~&RCLASS +profiles
+
{This function uses the RACF search command to generate a selection list.
{Do not specify quotes on profile names, these are assumed.
+
+
+
+RACF Filter+===>_RFILTER                                {(Enter search string)
+
+
+
+Filter examples:!**           DBW%.*            BMC.**
+                !EE.CEF.*     GS.ABC*.*         ISF*.**
+
+
+Wild cards:     !%  {Indicates one character
!                 *  {Indicates one or more characters
!                 ** {Indicates any number of qualifiers
+
+
+\ \Press~ENTER+to process or~END+to exit\ \
)INIT
  .CURSOR = RFILTER
  .HELP   = #RACMENU
)PROC
  VER  (&RFILTER,NB)
)END

RACFCLS3.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON)   JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   {  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)   COLOR(BLUE)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)   COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
+\-\(%RACFADM - General Resources+)\-\
%Command ===>_ZCMD                                              +Scroll==>_SAMT+
%
+Add RACF%_RCLASS  +profile: %RDEFINE+command and optionally a%PERMIT+
+
+PROFILE%===>_PROFILE                                         {(Enter%NEW{name)
+TYPE   %===>_TYPE    { (Enter%NEW{type)
+
+OWNER  %===>_OWNER   { (Owner of profile)
+UACC   %===>_UACC    { (Access level, NONE/EXECUTE/READ/UPDATE/ALTER/CONTROL)
+WARNING%===>_Z  {      (Warn or fail access, YES/NO)
+DATA   %===>_DATA
+
+FROM   %===>_FROM                     +%===>_FCLASS   { (Profile and Class)
+
{If%FROM{is set to a generic profile name then the%ACCESS LIST{from this
{profile is added to the new profile with a permit command immediately.
%Blank{the FROM field out, if you do%not{want this%permit{command done.
+
+FAILURE%===>_FAIL    { (Failure level to audit, normally READ)
+SUCCESS%===>_SUCC    { (Success level to audit, normally blank)
+
+\ \Press%ENTER+to process or%END+to exit\ \
)INIT
  .ZVARS  = '(WARN)'
  .CURSOR = PROFILE
  .HELP   = #RACCLSA
  &FCLASS = &RCLASS
  &OLDRCL = &RCLASS
  &OLDPRF = &PROFILE
  &OLDTYP = &TYPE
  &FROM   = &PROFILE
  &FAIL   = TRUNC(&FAIL,')')
  &SUCC   = TRUNC(&SUCC,')')
  IF (&PROFILE = NONE)
      &PROFILE = &RFILTER
      &FROM = ' '
  IF (&UACC = ' ')
      &UACC = NONE
)PROC
  IF (&OLDPRF = &PROFILE)
     IF (&OLDTYP = &TYPE)
        IF (&OLDRCL = &RCLASS)
            &PROFILE = ' '
  VER (&PROFILE,NB)
  VER (&OWNER,NB,NAME)
  VER (&TYPE,LIST,GEN,GENERIC,DISCRETE)
  VER (&UACC,NB,LIST,NONE,EXECUTE,READ,ALTER,CONTROL,UPDATE)
  VER (&FAIL,LIST,EXECUTE,READ,ALTER,CONTROL,UPDATE)
  VER (&SUCC,LIST,EXECUTE,READ,ALTER,CONTROL,UPDATE)
  VER (&WARN,NB,LIST,YES,NO)
)END

)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   @  TYPE(OUTPUT)  INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON)   JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   {  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)   COLOR(BLUE)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)   COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
+\-\(%RACFADM - Dataset Profiles+)\-\
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+Add RACF%DATASET+profile: %ADDSD+command and optionally a%PERMIT+
+
+PROFILE%===>_DATASET                                   { (Enter%NEW{name)
+
+OWNER  %===>_OWNER   { (Owner of profile)
+UACC   %===>_UACC    { (Access level, NONE/EXECUTE/READ/UPDATE/ALTER/CONTROL)
+WARNING%===>_Z  {      (Warn or fail access, YES/NO)
+DATA   %===>_DATA                                                           @Z
+
+FROM   %===>_FROM                                       {(Existing profile)
+
{If%FROM{is set to a generic profile name then the%ACCESS LIST{from this
{profile is added to the new profile with a permit command immediately.
%Blank{the FROM field out, if you do%not{want this%permit{command done.
+
+FAILURE%===>_FAIL    { (Failure level to audit, normally READ)
+SUCCESS%===>_SUCC    { (Success level to audit, normally blank)
+
+
+\ \Press%ENTER+to process or%END+to exit\ \
)INIT
  .ZVARS  = '(WARN SCIND)'
  .CURSOR = DATASET
  .HELP   = #RACDSNA
  &OLDDSN = &DATASET
  &OLDTYP = &TYPE
  &FROM   = &DATASET
  &FAIL   = TRUNC(&FAIL,')')
  &SUCC   = TRUNC(&SUCC,')')
  IF (&DATASET = NONE)
      &DATASET = &RFILTER
      &FROM = ' '
  IF (&UACC = ' ')
      &UACC = NONE
)PROC
  IF (&OLDDSN = &DATASET)
     IF (&OLDTYP = &TYPE)
         &DATASET = ' '
  VER (&DATASET,NB)
  VER (&OWNER,NB,NAME)
  VER (&WARN,NB,LIST,YES,NO)
  VER (&UACC,NB,LIST,NONE,EXECUTE,READ,ALTER,CONTROL,UPDATE)
  VER (&FAIL,LIST,EXECUTE,READ,ALTER,CONTROL,UPDATE)
  VER (&SUCC,LIST,EXECUTE,READ,ALTER,CONTROL,UPDATE)
  &TYPE = 'GEN'
)FIELD
  FIELD(DATA) IND(SCIND,'<>') LEN(255)
)END
/*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
/*                             Comments                               */
/*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
/*                                                                    */
/*  1) The 'DATA' field is a scrollable field                         */
/*                                                                    */
/*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/

RACFGRP2.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   @  TYPE(OUTPUT)  INTENS(HIGH) SKIP(ON)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) CAPS(ON) JUST(LEFT)   HILITE(USCORE)
   {  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(BLUE)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON) COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
+\-\(%RACFADM - Group Profiles+)\-\
%Command ===>_ZCMD                                              +Scroll==>_SAMT+
%
+Add RACF%GROUP+profile: %ADDGROUP+command
+
+PROFILE %===>_GROUP   { (Enter%NEW{name)
+
+OWNER   %===>_OWNER   { (Owner of profile)
+SUPGROUP%===>_SUPGRP  { (Superior group)
+
+
%              Installation Data: (no quotes)
%              --------------------------------------------------------------
+DATA    %===>_DATA                                                          @Z
+
+
+
+
+
+
+
+
+\ \Press%ENTER+to process or%END+to exit\ \
)INIT
  .CURSOR = GROUP
  .HELP   = #RACMENU
  .ZVARS   ='(SCIND)'
  &OLDGRP = &GROUP
  &FROM   = &GROUP
  IF (&GROUP = NONE)
      &GROUP = &RFILTER
)PROC
  IF (&OLDGRP = &GROUP)
      &GROUP = ' '
  VER (&GROUP,NB)
  VER (&OWNER,NB,NAME)
  VER (&SUPGRP,NB,NAME)
  VER (&DATA,NB)
)FIELD
  FIELD(DATA) IND(SCIND,'<>') LEN(255)
)END
/*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
/*                             Comments                               */
/*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
/*                                                                    */
/*  1) The 'DATA' field is a scrollable field                         */
/*                                                                    */
/*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/

RACFGRP6.text:
)ATTR DEFAULT(%+_)
   $  TYPE(OUTPUT)  INTENS(LOW)  JUST(LEFT) COLOR(TURQ)
   _  TYPE(INPUT)   INTENS(HIGH) JUST(LEFT) CAPS(ON)     HILITE(USCORE)
   {  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)   COLOR(BLUE)
   +  TYPE(TEXT)    INTENS(LOW)  SKIP(ON)   COLOR(GREEN)
)BODY EXPAND(\\)
+\-\(%RACFADM - Group Profiles+)\-\
%Command ===>_ZCMD
%
+Change RACF%GROUP+connection: %CONNECT+command

+

+Change the field below:
+

+
